title: internal compiler error: encountered incremental compilation error with predicates_of(core[460f]::cmp::PartialOrd)

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Related to #84970, I'm filling this because cargo asked nicely :) ### Code Context: this is an excerpt from a roguelike game that uses Legion as its ECS lib. I guess the bug was there, since it's the only place I'm using `.partial_cmp()`. It crashed after I added the `.sort_by(distance)` part. ```Rust // Collect all entities into the player's FOV let mut entities = <(Entity, &Point, &Renderable, &Name, Option<&CombatStats>)>::query() .iter(world) .collect::)>>(); // Sort them by distance from the player entities.sort_by(|&a, &b| { DistanceAlg::Pythagoras .distance2d(*a.1, *player_pos) .partial_cmp(&DistanceAlg::Pythagoras.distance2d(*b.1, *player_pos)) .unwrap_or(Ordering::Equal) }); ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.54.0 (a178d0322 2021-07-26) binary: rustc commit-hash: a178d0322ce20e33eac124758e837cbd80a6f633 commit-date: 2021-07-26 host: x86_64-pc-windows-msvc release: 1.54.0 LLVM version: 12.0.1 ``` ### Error output ``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Found unstable fingerprints for predicates_of(core[460f]::cmp::PartialOrd): GenericPredicates { parent: None, predicates: [(Binder(TraitPredicate(>), []), C:\[redacted]\.rustup\toolchains\stable-x86_64-pc-windows-msvc\lib/rustlib/src/rust\library\core\src\cmp.rs:936:43: 936:57 (#80706 (Binder(TraitPredicate(>), []), C:\[redacted]\.rustup\toolchains\stable-x86_64-pc-windows-msvc\lib/rustlib/src/rust\library\core\src\cmp.rs:936:1: 1041:2 (#0))] }', /rustc/a178d0322ce20e33eac124758e837cbd80a6f633\compiler\rustc_query_system\src\query\plumbing.rs:620:9 ``` Backtrace

``` ```
